inputs.remark:
V1（2001年，助听器购买）
V2（2004年，助听器更换）
V3（2007年，CI 植入）
V4（2007年 CI 激活后 2.5 个月，术后随访）
V5（2015年9月1日，私人诊所初诊）
V6-V17（2015年9月-2016年3月，12次调试/更换）
V18（2016年3月，购买助听器）
V19（持续性问题，助听器外壳维修）
V20（家庭咨询）
V21（治疗第6年，团体康复项目）
V22（团体康复后6个月，随访）
尝试以这个形式来调整内容。

logic_summary: Replaced expected_interpretations_by_visit to match the detailed timeline provided in REMARKS, covering history from 2001 to Year 6 of treatment.

value.collective_interpretation: 2001: Patient purchased hearing aids. Retrospectively identified as a potential CI candidate, but not referred.
2004: Patient purchased replacement hearing aids. Continued lack of referral for CI evaluation despite candidacy.
2007 (2.5 months post-activation): Post-operative follow-up showing significant reduction in handicap.

tests.name: Hearing Handicap Inventory (HHI)
tests.result_summary: Score decreased to 60 (significant improvement from pre-implant baseline).

value.collective_interpretation: 2015-09-01: Initial visit at private practice. Presented with moderate precipitously sloping to profound SNHL and dissatisfaction with current amplification.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral moderate precipitously sloping to profound SNHL.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Fitting
tests.result_summary: Switched from ITE to BTE hearing aids.

value.collective_interpretation: 2015-09 to 2016-03: 12 visits for 'tweaking', reprogramming, and device exchanges. Clinicians frustrated by 'difficult' behavior; adjustments provided no objective benefit.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Adjustments
tests.result_summary: Multiple gain adjustments (increases and decreases) and brand switches without resolution of complaints.

value.collective_interpretation: 2016-03: Patient purchased new hearing aids after 6 months of trials.
Ongoing: Repeated hearing aid casing repairs (9 times in 3 years) due to damage from hair products.
Family counseling session to address stigma and embarrassment regarding BTE hearing aids.
Treatment Year 6: Participation in Group Auditory Rehabilitation program.

tests.name: Hearing Handicap Inventory (HHI)
tests.result_summary: Pre-group score: 86. Post-group score: 58. Patient reported understanding benefits of HAs for the first time.

value.collective_interpretation: 6 months post-group follow-up: Regression of psychosocial benefit, indicating need for further intervention.
